022import static java.util.Arrays.deepToString;

024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NULL_STRING;

026import java.lang.reflect.Array;
027import java.util.Arrays;

029import java.util.Collections;

052/**
053 *  <p>{@summary This class consists of several utility methods working on
054 *  {@link Object}
055 *  instances, similar to those on
056 *  {@link Arrays}
057 *  or
058 *  {@link Collections}.}</p>
059 *  <p>The class was originally inspired by the class of the same name that
060 *  was finally introduced with the Java&nbsp;7 release; some of its methods
061 *  will delegate to
062 *  {@link java.util.Objects java.util.Objects},
063 *  others will extend the functionality of the methods with the same
064 *  name from {@code java.util.Objects}.</p>
065 *  <p>If a method from {@code java.util.Objects} would throw a
066 *  {@link NullPointerException},
067 *  the method with the same name from this class would throw a
068 *  {@link ValidationException}
069 *  instead.</p>
070 *
071 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
072 *  @version $Id: Objects.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $
073 *  @since 0.1.0
074 *
075 *  @UMLGraph.link
076 */
077@UtilityClass
078@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "UseOfObsoleteDateTimeApi", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
079@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Objects.java 1060 2023-09-24 19:21:40Z tquadrat $" )
080public final class Objects
081{
082        /*--------------*\
083    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
084        \*--------------*/
085    /**
086     *  No instance allowed for this class.
087     */
088    private Objects() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Objects.class ); }
089
090        /*---------*\
091    ====** Methods **==========================================================
092        \*---------*/
093    /**
094     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
095     *  to {@code fromIndex + size} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range
096     *  from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
097     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
098     *  inequalities is true:</p>
099     *  <ul>
100     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
101     *    <li>{@code size < 0}</li>
102     *    <li>{@code fromIndex + size > length}, taking into account integer
103     *    overflow</li>
104     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
105     *    inequalities</li>
106     *  </ul>
107     *  <p>Calls
108     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize(int,int,int)}
109     *  internally.</p>
110     *
111     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-interval.
112     *  @param  size    The size of the sub-range.
113     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
114     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
115     *      range.
116     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
117     */
118    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
119    public static final int checkFromIndexSize( final int fromIndex, final int size, final int length )
120    {
121        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkFromIndexSize( fromIndex, size, length );
122
123        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
124        return retValue;
125    }   //  checkFromIndexSize()
126
127    /**
128     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the sub-range from {@code fromIndex} (inclusive)
129     *  to {@code toIndex} (exclusive) is within the bounds of range from
130     *  {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
131     *  <p>The sub-range is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the following
132     *  inequalities is true:</p>
133     *  <ul>
134     *    <li>{@code fromIndex < 0}</li>
135     *    <li>{@code fromIndex > toIndex}</li>
136     *    <li>{@code toIndex > length}</li>
137     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
138     *    inequalities</li>
139     *  </ul>
140     *  <p>Calls
141     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkFromToIndex(int,int,int) java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex(int,int,int)}
142     *  internally.</p>
143     *
144     *  @param  fromIndex   The lower-bound (inclusive) of the sub-range.
145     *  @param  toIndex The upper-bound (exclusive) of the sub-range.
146     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) the range.
147     *  @return The {@code fromIndex} if the sub-range is within bounds of the
148     *      range.
149     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The sub-range is out-of-bounds.
150     */
151    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
152    public static final int checkFromToIndex( final int fromIndex, final int toIndex, final int length )
153    {
154        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkFromToIndex( fromIndex, toIndex, length );
155
156        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
157        return retValue;
158    }   //  checkFromToIndex()
159
160    /**
161     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the {@code index} is within the bounds of the
162     *  range from {@code 0} (inclusive) to {@code length} (exclusive).}</p>
163     *  <p>The {@code index} is defined to be out-of-bounds if any of the
164     *  following inequalities is true:</p>
165     *  <ul>
166     *    <li>{@code index < 0}</li>
167     *    <li>{@code index >= length}</li>
168     *    <li>{@code length < 0}, which is implied from the former
169     *    inequalities</li>
170     *  </ul>
171     *  <p>Calls
172     *  {@link java.util.Objects#checkIndex(int,int) java.util.Objects.checkIndex(int,int)}
173     *  internally.</p>
174     *
175     *  @param  index   The index.
176     *  @param  length  The upper-bound (exclusive) of the range.
177     *  @return The {@code index} if it is within bounds of the range.
178     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The {@code index} is out-of-bounds.
179     */
180    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
181    public static final int checkIndex( final int index, final int length )
182    {
183        final var retValue = java.util.Objects.checkIndex( index, length );
184
185        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
186        return retValue;
187    }   //  checkIndex()
188
189    /**
190     *  <p>{@summary Throws the exception provided by the given supplier if the
191     *  condition resolves to {@code false}.}</p>
192     *  <p>Basically, this method is a replacement for the code sequence
193     *  below:</p>
194     *  <pre><code>  â¦
195     *  if( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt; )
196     *  {
197     *      throw new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; );
198     *  }
199     *  â¦</code></pre>
200     *  <p>that may be easier to read than the {@code if} statement:</p>
201     *  <pre><code>  â¦
202     *  checkState( !&lt;<i>condition</i>&gt;, () -> new &lt;<i>WhatEver</i>&gt;Exception( &lt;<i>WhatEverMessage</i>&gt; ) );
203     *  â¦</code></pre>
204     *
205     *  @param  <E> The type of the exception that is thrown in case the
206     *      condition is not met.
207     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
208     *  @param  exception   The exception to throw.
209     *  @throws E   The condition was not met.
210     */
211    @SuppressWarnings( "CheckedExceptionClass" )
212    public static final <E extends Exception> void checkState( final boolean condition, final Supplier<E> exception ) throws E
213    {
214        if( !condition ) throw requireNonNullArgument( exception, "exception" ).get();
215    }   //  checkState()
216
217    /**
218     *  <p>{@summary Returns 0 if the arguments are identical and
219     *  {@code comparator.compare(a, b)} otherwise.}</p>
220     *  <p>Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, 0 is returned.</p>
221     *  <p>Calls
222     *  {@link java.util.Objects#compare(Object,Object,Comparator) java.util.Objects#compare()}
223     *  internally, but different from that method, this implementation will
224     *  throw a
225     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
226     *  in case the {@code comparator} is {@code null}.</p>
227     *
228     *  @param  <T> The type of the objects being compared.
229     *  @param  object  An object.
230     *  @param  other   Another object to be compared with the first object.
231     *  @param  comparator  The
232     *      {@link Comparator}
233     *      to compare the first two arguments.
234     *  @return 0 if the arguments are identical and +1, 0, or -1, based on the
235     *      return value of {@code c.compare(a, b)} otherwise.
236     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code comparator} is {@code null}.
237     *
238     *  @see Comparable
239     *  @see Comparator
240     */
241    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
242    public static final <T> int compare( final T object, final T other, final Comparator<? super T> comparator ) throws NullArgumentException
243    {
244        final var retValue = object == other ? 0 : signum( java.util.Objects.compare( object, other, requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" ) ) );
245
246        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
247        return retValue;
248    }   //  compare()
249
250    /**
251     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to
252     *  each other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
253     *  <p>Two {@code null} values are deeply equal. If both arguments are
254     *  arrays, the algorithm in
255     *  {@link Arrays#deepEquals(Object[], Object[]) Arrays.deepEquals()}
256     *  is used to determine equality. Otherwise, equality is determined by
257     *  using the
258     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
259     *  method of the first argument.</p>
260     *  <p>Calls
261     *  {@link java.util.Objects#deepEquals(Object,Object) java.util.Objects#deepEquals()}
262     *  internally.</p>
263     *
264     *  @param  object  An object.
265     *  @param  other   Another object to be compared with the first object for
266     *      deep equality.
267     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are deeply equal to each other
268     *      and {@code false} otherwise.
269     *
270     *  @see    Arrays#deepEquals(Object[],Object[])
271     *  @see    Objects#equals(Object,Object)
272     */
273    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
274    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
275    public static final boolean deepEquals( final Object object, final Object other ) { return java.util.Objects.deepEquals( object, other ); }
276
277    /**
278     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each
279     *  other and {@code false} otherwise.}</p>
280     *  <p> Consequently, if both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is
281     *  returned and if exactly one argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is
282     *  returned.  Otherwise, equality is determined by using the
283     *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
284     *  method of the first argument.</p>
285     *  <p>Calls
286     *  {@link java.util.Objects#equals(Object, Object)}
287     *  internally.</p>
288     *
289     *  @param  object  An object.
290     *  @param  other   Another object to be compared with the first one for
291     *      equality.
292     *  @return {@code true} if the arguments are equal to each other and
293     *      {@code false} otherwise.
294     *
295     *  @see    Object#equals(Object)
296     */
297    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
298    public static final boolean equals( final Object object, final Object other ) { return java.util.Objects.equals( object, other ); }
299
300    /**
301     *  <p>{@summary Generates a hash code for a sequence of input values.} The
302     *  hash code is generated as if all the input values were placed into an
303     *  array, and that array is hashed by calling
304     *  {@link Arrays#hashCode(Object[])}.</p>
305     *  <p>Calls
306     *  {@link java.util.Arrays#hashCode(Object[]) java.util.Arrays.hashCode()}
307     *  internally.</p>
308     *
309     *  @param  values  The values to be hashed.
310     *  @return A hash value of the sequence of input values.
311     *
312     *  @see    List#hashCode
313     */
314    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
315    public static final int hash( final Object... values ) { return Arrays.hashCode( values ); }
316
317    /**
318     *  <p>{@summary Returns the hash code of a non-{@code null} argument and 0
319     *  for a {@code null} argument.}</p>
320     *  <p>Calls
321     *  {@link java.util.Objects#hashCode(Object) java.util.Objects.hashCode(Object)}
322     *  internally.</p>
323     *
324     *  @param o   An object.
325     *  @return The hash code of an argument that is not {@code null}, and 0
326     *      for a {@code null} argument,
327     *
328     *  @see    Object#hashCode
329     */
330    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
331    public static final int hashCode( final Object o ) { return java.util.Objects.hashCode( o ); }
332
333    /**
334     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is
335     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
336     *  <p>This method can be used as a
337     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
338     *  {@code filter(Objects::isNull)}.</p>
339     *  <p>Calls
340     *  {@link java.util.Objects#isNull(Object) java.util.Objects.isNull()}
341     *  internally.</p>
342     *
343     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}.
344     *  @return {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null},
345     *      otherwise {@code false}
346     *
347     *  @see    java.util.function.Predicate
348     *  @see    org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#IS_NULL
349     */
350    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
351    public static final boolean isNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.isNull( obj ); }
352
353    /**
354     *  <p>{@summary Provides a replacement value if the given value is
355     *  {@code null}.}</p>
356     *
357     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
358     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
359     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the replacement function.
360     *  @return The provided object if that is not {@code null}, or the result
361     *      from the supplier method. Keep in mind that this result can be
362     *      {@code null}!
363     */
364    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.2" )
365    public static final <T> T mapFromNull( final T o, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier )
366    {
367        final var retValue = isNull( o )
368            ? requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).get()
369            : o;
370
371        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
372        return retValue;
373    }   //  mapFromNull()
374
375    /**
376     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
377     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null}.}</p>
378     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance
379     *  is {@code null}.</p>
380     *
381     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
382     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
383     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
384     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
385     *  @return The result of the mapping, or {@code null} if the given object
386     *      instance was already {@code null}. Keep in mind that the result of
387     *      the mapping can be {@code null}!
388     */
389    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,? extends R> mapper )
390    {
391        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
392        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : null;
393
394        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
395        return retValue;
396    }   //  mapNonNull()
397
398    /**
399     *  <p>{@summary Maps (converts) the given object instance by applying the
400     *  provided mapper if the instance is not {@code null} or returns the
401     *  given default value.}</p>
402     *  <p>The mapper function will not be called at all if the given instance
403     *  is {@code null}.</p>
404     *
405     *  @param  <T> The type of the object to map.
406     *  @param  <R> The type of the result.
407     *  @param  o   The object to map; can be {@code null}.
408     *  @param  mapper  The mapping function.
409     *  @param  defaultValue    The default value; can be {@code null}.
410     *  @return The result of the mapping, or the default value if the given
411     *      object instance is {@code null}. Keep in mind that the result of
412     *      the mapping can be {@code null}!
413     */
414    public static final <T,R> R mapNonNull( final T o, final Function<T,? extends R> mapper, final R defaultValue )
415    {
416        @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantExplicitVariableType" )
417        final R retValue = nonNull( o ) ? requireNonNullArgument( mapper, "mapper" ).apply( o ) : defaultValue;
418
419        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
420        return retValue;
421    }   //  mapNonNull()
422
423    /**
424     *  <p>{@summary Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is not
425     *  {@code null}, otherwise returns {@code false}.}</p>
426     *  <p>This method exists to be used as a
427     *  {@link java.util.function.Predicate},
428     *  {@code filter(Objects::nonNull)}</p>
429     *  <p>Calls
430     *  {@link java.util.Objects#nonNull(Object) java.util.Objects.nonNull()}
431     *  internally.</p>
432     *
433     *  @param  obj A reference to be checked against {@code null}
434     *  @return {@code false} if the provided reference is {@code null},
435     *      otherwise {@code true}
436     *
437     *  @see java.util.function.Predicate
438     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NON_NULL
439     */
440    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanMethodNameMustStartWithQuestion" )
441    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
442    public static final boolean nonNull( final Object obj ) { return java.util.Objects.nonNull( obj ); }
443
444    /**
445     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
446     *  {@link ValidationException}
447     *  is thrown.
448     *
449     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
450     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
451     *  @param  validation  The validation
452     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
453     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
454     *
455     *  @since 0.1.0
456     */
457    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
458    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
459    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
460    {
461        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
462        {
463            throw new ValidationException();
464        }
465
466        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
467        return obj;
468    }   //  require()
469
470    /**
471     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
472     *  {@link ValidationException}
473     *  with the specified message is thrown.
474     *
475     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
476     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
477     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
478     *  @param  validation  The validation
479     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
480     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
481     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
482     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
483     *
484     *  @since 0.1.0
485     */
486    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
487    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final String message, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
488    {
489        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
490
491        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
492        {
493            throw new ValidationException( message );
494        }
495
496        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
497        return obj;
498    }   //  require()
499
500    /**
501     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
502     *  that fails, a customized
503     *  {@link ValidationException}
504     *  is thrown.}</p>
505     *  <p>Unlike the method
506     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
507     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
508     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
509     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care should be taken
510     *  that the costs for the creation of the message supplier are less than
511     *  the cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
512     *
513     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
514     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
515     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
516     *      in the event that {@code ValidationException} is thrown. If
517     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
518     *      provided to the exception.
519     *  @param  validation  The validation
520     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
521     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The validation is {@code null}.
522     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obk} failed the validation.
523     *
524     *  @since 0.1.0
525     */
526    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
527    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
528    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
529    {
530        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
531        {
532            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
533                ? new ValidationException( messageSupplier.get() )
534                : new ValidationException();
535            throw exception;
536        }
537
538        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
539        return obj;
540    }   //  require()
541
542    /**
543     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
544     *  that fails, a customized
545     *  {@link ValidationException}
546     *  is thrown.}</p>
547     *  <p>Unlike the method
548     *  {@link #require(Object,String,Predicate)},
549     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
550     *  validation was performed (and failed). While this may confer a
551     *  performance advantage in the success case, some care  should be taken
552     *  that the costs the creation of the message supplier are less than the
553     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
554     *  <p>This implementation is different from
555     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object, Supplier)}
556     *  as it takes an instance of
557     *  {@link Function}
558     *  for the {@code messageSupplier}. That function is called with
559     *  {@code obj} as the argument; this allows to add the invalid value to
560     *  the exception detail message. The provided message supplier function
561     *  must accept {@code null} as a valid argument.</p>
562     *
563     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
564     *  @param  obj The value to check; can be {@code null}.
565     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
566     *      in the event that a {@code ValidationException} is thrown. If
567     *      {@code null} or if it returns {@code null}, no detail message is
568     *      provided.
569     *  @param  validation  The validation
570     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
571     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The validation is {@code null}.
572     *  @throws ValidationException {@code obj} failed the validation.
573     *
574     *  @since 0.1.0
575     */
576    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
577    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
578    public static final <T> T require( final T obj, final Function<? super T,String> messageSupplier, final Predicate<? super T> validation ) throws ValidationException
579    {
580        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( obj ) )
581        {
582            final var exception = nonNull( messageSupplier )
583                ? new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( obj ) )
584                : new NullArgumentException();
585            throw exception;
586        }
587
588        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
589        return obj;
590    }   //  require()
591
592    /**
593     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code obj} is {@code null} and
594     *  throws a
595     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
596     *  if it is {@code null}.}</p>
597     *
598     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
599     *  @param  obj The value to check.
600     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
601     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code obj} is {@code null}.
602     *
603     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object)
604     */
605    @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
606    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
607    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj ) throws NullArgumentException
608    {
609        if( isNull( obj ) ) throw new NullArgumentException();
610
611        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
612        return obj;
613    }   //  requireNonNull()
614
615    /**
616     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given value {@code obj} is {@code null} and
617     *  throws a
618     *  {@link ValidationException}
619     *  with the specified message if it is {@code null}.}</p>
620     *
621     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
622     *  @param  obj The value to check.
623     *  @param  message The message that is set to the thrown exception.
624     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
625     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code message} is {@code null}.
626     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code obj} is {@code null}.
627     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code message} is the empty String.
628     *
629     *  @see java.util.Objects#requireNonNull(Object,String)
630     */
631    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
632    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj, final String message ) throws ValidationException, NullArgumentException, EmptyArgumentException
633    {
634        requireNotEmptyArgument( message, "message" );
635        if( isNull( obj ) ) throw new ValidationException( message );
636
637        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
638        return obj;
639    }   //  requireNonNull()
640
641    /**
642     *  <p>{@summary Checks that the specified object reference is not
643     *  {@code null} and throws a customized
644     *  {@link ValidationException}
645     *  if it is.}</p>
646     *  <p>Unlike the method
647     *  {@link #requireNonNull(Object,String)},
648     *  this method allows to defer the creation of the message until after the
649     *  null check failed. While this may confer a performance advantage in the
650     *  non-{@code null} case, when deciding to call this method care should be
651     *  taken that the costs of creating the message supplier are less than the
652     *  cost of just creating the String message directly.</p>
653     *
654     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
655     *  @param  obj The value to check.
656     *  @param  messageSupplier The supplier of the detail message to be used
657     *      in the event that a {@code NullArgumentException} is thrown. If
658     *      {@code null}, no detail message is provided.
659     *  @return The value if it is not {@code null}.
660     *  @throws ValidationException    {@code obj} is {@code null}
661     */
662    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
663    public static final <T> T requireNonNull( final T obj, final Supplier<String> messageSupplier) throws ValidationException
664    {
665        if( isNull( obj ) )
666        {
667            final var message = nonNull( messageSupplier ) ? messageSupplier.get() : null;
668            @SuppressWarnings( "NewExceptionWithoutArguments" )
669            final var exception = isNull( message ) ? new NullArgumentException() : new ValidationException( message );
670            throw exception;
671        }
672
673        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
674        return obj;
675    }   //  requireNonNull()
676
677    /**
678     *  Checks if the given argument {@code a} is {@code null} and throws a
679     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
680     *  if it is {@code null}.
681     *
682     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
683     *  @param  arg The argument to check.
684     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
685     *      message.
686     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}.
687     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
688     */
689    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
690    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name )
691    {
692        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
693        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
694        if( isNull( arg ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
695
696        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
697        return arg;
698    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
699
700    /**
701     *  <p>{@summary Checks if not both of the given arguments {@code arg} and
702     *  {@code otherArg} are {@code null} and throws a
703     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
704     *  if both are {@code null}.} Otherwise, it returns {@code arg}.</p>
705     *
706     *  @param  <T> The type of the first argument to check.
707     *  @param  arg The first argument to check; it will be returned in case of
708     *      success, even if {@code null}.
709     *  @param  otherArg    The other argument to check.
710     *  @param  name    The name of the first argument; this is used for the
711     *      error message.
712     *  @param  otherName   The name of the other argument; this is used for
713     *      the error message.
714     *  @return The first argument, even that might be {@code null}.
715     *  @throws NullArgumentException   Both arguments are {@code null}.
716     */
717    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.7" )
718    public static final <T> T requireNonNullArgument( final T arg, final Object otherArg, final String name, final String otherName )
719    {
720        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
721        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
722        if( isNull( otherName ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "otherName" );
723        if( otherName.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "otherName" );
724        if( isNull( arg ) && isNull( otherArg ) )
725        {
726            throw new NullArgumentException( name, otherName );
727        }
728
729        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
730        return arg;
731    }   //  requireNonNullArgument()
732
733    /**
734     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given String argument {@code arg} is
735     *  {@code null}, empty or blank and throws a
736     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
737     *  if it is {@code null}, an
738     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
739     *  if it is empty, or a
740     *  {@link BlankArgumentException}
741     *  if it is blank.}</p>
742     *
743     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
744     *  @param  arg The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
745     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
746     *      message.
747     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null}, empty or blank.
748     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
749     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code arg} is empty.
750     *  @throws BlankArgumentException   {@code arg} is blank.
751     *
752     *  @see    String#isBlank()
753     */
754    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
755    public static final <T extends CharSequence> T requireNotBlankArgument( final T arg, final String name )
756    {
757        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
758        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
759
760        switch( arg )
761        {
762            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
763            //noinspection QuestionableName
764            case final String string ->
765            {
766                if( string.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
767                if( string.isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
768            }
769            case final CharSequence charSequence ->
770            {
771                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
772                if( charSequence.toString().isBlank() ) throw new BlankArgumentException( name );
773            }
774        }
775
776        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
777        return arg;
778    }   //  requireNotBlankArgument()
779
780    /**
781     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code arg} is {@code null} or
782     *  empty and throws a
783     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
784     *  if it is {@code null}, or an
785     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
786     *  if it is empty.}</p>
787     *  <p>Strings, arrays, instances of
788     *  {@link java.util.Collection} and
789     *  {@link java.util.Map}
790     *  as well as instances of
791     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuilder},
792     *  {@link java.lang.StringBuffer},
793     *  and
794     *  {@link java.lang.CharSequence}
795     *  will be checked on being empty.</p>
796     *  <p>For an instance of
797     *  {@link java.util.Optional},
798     *  the presence of a value is checked in order to determine whether the
799     *  {@link Optional} is empty or not.</p>
800     *  <p>Because the interface
801     *  {@link java.util.Enumeration}
802     *  does not provide an API for the check on emptiness
803     *  ({@link java.util.Enumeration#hasMoreElements() hasMoreElements()}
804     *  will return {@code false} after all elements have been taken from
805     *  the {@code Enumeration} instance), the result for arguments of this
806     *  type has to be taken with caution.</p>
807     *  <p>For instances of
808     *  {@link java.util.stream.Stream},
809     *  this method will only check for {@code null} (like
810     *  {@link #requireNonNullArgument(Object,String)}.
811     *  This is because any operation on the stream itself would render it
812     *  unusable for later processing.</p>
813     *  <p>In case the argument is of type
814     *  {@link Optional},
815     *  this method behaves different from
816     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String)};
817     *  this one will return the {@code Optional} instance, while the other
818     *  method will return the contents of the {@code Optional}.</p>
819     *  <p>This method will not work properly for instances of
820     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner}, because its method
821     *  {@link java.util.StringJoiner#length() length()}
822     *  will not return 0 when a prefix, suffix, or an
823     *  &quot;{@linkplain java.util.StringJoiner#setEmptyValue(CharSequence) empty value}&quot;
824     *  was provided.</p>
825     *
826     *  @param  <T> The type of the argument to check.
827     *  @param  arg The argument to check; may be {@code null}.
828     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
829     *      message.
830     *  @return The argument if it is not {@code null} or empty.
831     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg} is {@code null}.
832     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code arg} is empty.
833     */
834    @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyComplexMethod" )
835    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
836    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( final T arg, final String name )
837    {
838        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
839        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
840
841        switch( arg )
842        {
843            /*
844             * When using guarding expressions, the code would not get better
845             * to read and to understand, as the positive cases will be handled
846             * all by the default case.
847             */
848            case null -> throw new NullArgumentException( name );
849            case final CharSequence charSequence ->
850            {
851                if( charSequence.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
852            }
853            case final Collection<?> collection ->
854            {
855                if( collection.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
856            }
857            case final Map<?,?> map ->
858            {
859                if( map.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
860            }
861            case final Enumeration<?> enumeration ->
862            {
863                /*
864                 * The funny thing with an Enumeration is that it could have
865                 * been not empty in the beginning, but it may be empty
866                 * (= having no more elements) now.
867                 * The good thing is that Enumeration.hasMoreElements() will
868                 * not change the state of the Enumeration - at least it should
869                 * not do so.
870                 */
871                if( !enumeration.hasMoreElements() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
872            }
873            case final Optional<?> optional ->
874            {
875                /*
876                 * This is different from the behaviour of
877                 * requireNotEmptyArgument(Optional,String) as the Optional
878                 * will be returned here.
879                 */
880                if( optional.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
881            }
882            default ->
883            {
884                if( arg.getClass().isArray() )
885                {
886                    if( Array.getLength( arg ) == 0 ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( name );
887                }
888                else
889                {
890                    /*
891                     * Other data types are not further processed; in
892                     * particular, instances of Stream cannot be checked on
893                     * being empty. This is because any operation on the Stream
894                     * itself will change its state and may make the Stream
895                     * unusable.
896                     */
897                }
898            }
899        }
900
901        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
902        return arg;
903    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
904
905    /**
906     *  <p>{@summary Checks if the given argument {@code optional} of type
907     *  {@link Optional}
908     *  is {@code null} or
909     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
910     *  and throws a
911     *  {@link NullArgumentException}
912     *  if it is {@code null}, or a
913     *  {@link EmptyArgumentException}
914     *  if it is empty.}</p>
915     *  <p>Otherwise it returns the value of the {@code Optional}.</p>
916     *  <p>This is different from the behaviour of
917     *  {@link #requireNotEmptyArgument(Object,String)}
918     *  with an instance of {@code Optional} as the argument to test.</p>
919     *
920     *  @param  <T> The type of the given {@code Optional} to check.
921     *  @param  optional    The argument to check; can be {@code null}.
922     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
923     *      message.
924     *  @return The value of the argument if {@code optional} is not
925     *      {@code null}
926     *      and not
927     *      {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}. This could be the empty
928     *      string!
929     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code optional} is {@code null}.
930     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException   {@code optional} is empty.
931     */
932    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
933    public static final <T> T requireNotEmptyArgument( @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" ) final Optional<T> optional, final String name )
934    {
935        if( isNull( name ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( "name" );
936        if( name.isEmpty() ) throw new EmptyArgumentException( "name" );
937
938        //---* Check for null *------------------------------------------------
939        if( isNull( optional ) ) throw new NullArgumentException( name );
940        final var retValue = optional.orElseThrow( () -> new EmptyArgumentException( name ) );
941
942        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
943        return retValue;
944    }   //  requireNotEmptyArgument()
945
946    /**
947     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
948     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} second argument.}</p>
949     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
950     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object,Object) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse(Object,Object)}
951     *  as it will always check that the default is not {@code null}.</p>
952     *
953     *  @param <T>  The type of the references.
954     *  @param  obj An object reference.
955     *  @param  defaultObj  Another object reference to be returned if the
956     *      first argument is {@code null}.
957     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
958     *      second argument if it is not {@code null}.
959     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code defaultObj} is {@code null}.
960     *
961     *  @see    java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElse(Object, Object)
962     */
963    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
964    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElse( final T obj, final T defaultObj ) throws NullArgumentException
965    {
966        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElse( obj, requireNonNullArgument( defaultObj, "defaultObj" ) );
967    }   //  requireNonNullElse()
968
969    /**
970     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first argument if it is not {@code null},
971     *  otherwise it returns the non-{@code null} value returned by
972     *  {@link Supplier#get() supplier.get()}.}</p>
973     *  <p>This implementation behaves different from that in
974     *  {@link java.util.Objects#requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier) java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet(Object,Supplier)}
975     *  as it will always check that the supplier is not {@code null}.</p>
976     *
977     *  @note   Although the provided {@code Supplier} may not be {@code null},
978     *      it may <i>return</i> {@code null}.
979     *
980     *  @param <T>  The type of the reference.
981     *  @param  obj An object reference.
982     *  @param  supplier    The supplier of a non-{@code null} object of type
983     *      {code T} to return if the first argument is {@code null}.
984     *  @return The first argument if it is not {@code null}, otherwise the
985     *      value returned by a call to {@code supplier.get()} if it is not
986     *      {@code null}.
987     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The {@code supplier} is {@code null}.
988     *  @throws NullPointerException    {@code obj} is {@code null} and the
989     *      return value of {@code supplier.get()} value is {@code null}, too.
990     */
991    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionDeclared" )
992    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
993    public static final <T> T requireNonNullElseGet( final T obj, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier ) throws NullArgumentException, NullPointerException
994    {
995        return java.util.Objects.requireNonNullElseGet( obj, requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ) );
996    }   //  requireNonNullElseGet()
997
998    /**
999     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
1000     *  {@link ValidationException}
1001     *  with a default message is thrown.
1002     *
1003     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1004     *  @param  arg The value to check; can be {@code null}.
1005     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1006     *      message.
1007     *  @param  validation  The validation
1008     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1009     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1010     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
1011     *      {@code null}.
1012     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1013     *
1014     *  @since 0.1.0
1015     */
1016    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1017    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
1018    {
1019        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1020
1021        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1022        {
1023            throw new ValidationException( "Validation failed for '%s'".formatted( name ) );
1024        }
1025
1026        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1027        return arg;
1028    }   //  requireValidArgument()
1029
1030    /**
1031     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
1032     *  that fails, a
1033     *  {@link ValidationException}
1034     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1035     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1036     *  argument.</p>
1037     *
1038     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1039     *  @param  arg The value to check; can be {@code null}.
1040     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1041     *      message.
1042     *  @param  validation  The validation
1043     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1044     *      exception.
1045     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1046     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1047     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
1048     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1049     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1050     *
1051     *  @since 0.1.0
1052     */
1053    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1054    public static final <T> T requireValidArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1055    {
1056        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1057        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );
1058
1059        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1060        {
1061            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1062        }
1063
1064        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1065        return arg;
1066    }   //  requireValidArgument()
1067
1068    /**
1069     *  Applies the given validation on the given value, and if that fails, an
1070     *  {@link ValidationException}
1071     *  with a default message is thrown.
1072     *
1073     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1074     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1075     *      message.
1076     *  @param  validation  The validation
1077     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1078     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1079     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name} or {@code validation} is
1080     *      {@code null}.
1081     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1082     *
1083     *  @since 0.2.0
1084     */
1085    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
1086    public static final double requireValidDoubleArgument( final double arg, final String name, final DoublePredicate validation )
1087    {
1088        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1089
1090        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( arg ) )
1091        {
1092            throw new ValidationException( "Validation failed for '%s'".formatted( name ) );
1093        }
1094
1095        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1096        return arg;
1097    }   //  requireValidDoubleArgument()
1098
1099    /**
1100     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value, and if
1101     *  that fails, a
1102     *  {@link ValidationException}
1103     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1104     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1105     *  argument.</p>
1106     *
1107     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1108     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1109     *      message.
1110     *  @param  validation  The validation
1111     *  @param  messageSupplier The function that generates the message for the
1112     *      exception.
1113     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1114     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1115     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code name}, {@code validation} or
1116     *      {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1117     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1118     *
1119     *  @since 0.2.0
1120     */
1121    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )

1272    /**
1273     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1274     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, an
1275     *  {@link ValidationException}
1276     *  with a default message is thrown.}</p>
1277     *  <p>If the value is {@code null}, the validation is never triggered.</p>
1278     *
1279     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.
1280     *  @param  arg The value to check.
1281     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1282     *      message.
1283     *  @param  validation  The validation
1284     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1285     *  @throws ValidationException {@code a} failed the validation.
1286     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg}, {@code name} or
1287     *      {@code validation} is {@code null}.
1288     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1289     *
1290     *  @since 0.1.0
1291     */
1292    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1293    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation )
1294    {
1295        requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" );
1296
1297        if( !requireNonNullArgument( validation, "validation" ).test( requireNonNullArgument( arg, "name" ) ) )
1298        {
1299            throw new ValidationException( "Validation failed for '%s'".formatted( name ) );
1300        }
1301
1302        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1303        return arg;
1304    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1305
1306    /**
1307     *  <p>{@summary Applies the given validation on the given value (that must
1308     *  not be {@code null}), and if that fails, a
1309     *  {@link ValidationException}
1310     *  is thrown.} The message for the exception will be provided by the given
1311     *  message supplier that takes the name of the argument as an
1312     *  argument.</p>
1313     *
1314     *  @param  <T> The type of the value to check.

1316     *  @param  name    The name of the argument; this is used for the error
1317     *      message.

1320     *      exception.
1321     *  @return The value if the validation succeeds.
1322     *  @throws ValidationException {@code arg} failed the validation.
1323     *  @throws NullArgumentException   {@code arg}, {@code name},
1324     *      {@code validation} or {@code messageProvider} is {@code null}.
1325     *  @throws EmptyArgumentException  {@code name} is the empty String.
1326     *

1328     */

1330    public static final <T> T requireValidNonNullArgument( final T arg, final String name, final Predicate<? super T> validation, final UnaryOperator<String> messageSupplier )
1331    {

1333        requireNonNullArgument( messageSupplier, "messageSupplier" );

1336        {
1337            throw new ValidationException( messageSupplier.apply( name ) );
1338        }
1339
1340        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1341        return arg;
1342    }   //  requireValidNonNullArgument()
1343
1344    /**
1345     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1346     *  {@link String},
1347     *  usually by calling its
1348     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1349     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1350     *  &quot;{@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING null}&quot;
1351     *  will be returned instead. Arrays will be converted to a String through
1352     *  calling the respective {@code toString()} method from
1353     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1354     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1355     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object, String) java.util.Objects.toString()}).
1356     *  Values of type
1357     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1358     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1359     *  will be translated based on the default locale - whatever that is.
1360     *
1361     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1362     *  @return The object's string representation.
1363     *
1364     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1365     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1366     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1367     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1368     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1369     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1370     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1371     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1372     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1373     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1374     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1375     *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NULL_STRING
1376     */
1377    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1378    public static final String toString( final Object object )
1379    {
1380        return toString( object, NULL_STRING );
1381    }   //  toString()
1382
1383    /**
1384     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument {@code object} into a
1385     *  {@link String},
1386     *  usually by calling its
1387     *  {@link Object#toString() toString()}
1388     *  method.} If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1389     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1390     *  instead.</p>
1391     *  <p>Arrays will be converted to a string through calling the respective
1392     *  {@code toString()} method from
1393     *  {@link java.util.Arrays}
1394     *  (this distinguishes this implementation from
1395     *  {link java.util.Objects#toString(Object,String) java.util.Objects.toString(Object,String)}).</p>
1396     *  <p>Values of type
1397     *  {@link java.util.Date} or
1398     *  {@link java.util.Calendar}
1399     *  will be translated based on the
1400     *  {@link java.util.Locale#getDefault() default locale}
1401     *  â whatever that is.</p>
1402     *
1403     *  @param  object  The object; may be {@code null}.
1404     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1405     *      is {@code null}.
1406     *  @return The object's string representation.
1407     *
1408     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(boolean[])
1409     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(byte[])
1410     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(char[])
1411     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(double[])
1412     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(float[])
1413     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(int[])
1414     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(long[])
1415     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(Object[])
1416     *  @see java.util.Arrays#toString(short[])
1417     *  @see java.util.Arrays#deepToString(Object[])
1418     *  @see java.util.Locale#getDefault()
1419     */
1420    @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks", "OverlyComplexMethod"} )
1421    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1422    public static final String toString( final Object object, final String nullDefault )
1423    {
1424        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1425        if( nonNull( object ) )
1426        {
1427            final var objectClass = object.getClass();
1428            if( objectClass.isArray() )
1429            {
1430                if( objectClass == byte [].class )
1431                {
1432                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (byte []) object );
1433                }
1434                else if( objectClass == short [].class )
1435                {
1436                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (short []) object );
1437                }
1438                else if( objectClass == int [].class )
1439                {
1440                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (int []) object );
1441                }
1442                else if( objectClass == long [].class )
1443                {
1444                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (long []) object );
1445                }
1446                else if( objectClass == char [].class )
1447                {
1448                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (char []) object );
1449                }
1450                else if( objectClass == float [].class )
1451                {
1452                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (float []) object );
1453                }
1454                else if( objectClass == double [].class )
1455                {
1456                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (double []) object );
1457                }
1458                else if( objectClass == boolean [].class )
1459                {
1460                    retValue = Arrays.toString( (boolean []) object );
1461                }
1462                else
1463                {
1464                    retValue = deepToString( (Object []) object );
1465                }
1466            }
1467            else
1468            {
1469                retValue = object.toString();
1470            }
1471        }
1472
1473        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1474        return retValue;
1475    }   //  toString()
1476
1477    /**
1478     *  <p>{@summary Converts the given argument into a
1479     *  {@link String}
1480     *  using the given instance of
1481     *  {@link Stringer}.}
1482     *  If the value of the argument is {@code null}, the text
1483     *  provided as the {@code nullDefault} argument will be returned
1484     *  instead.</p>
1485     *
1486     *  @param  <T> The type of the object.
1487     *  @param  value   The object; may be {@code null}.
1488     *  @param  stringer    The method that is used to convert the given object
1489     *      to a String.
1490     *  @param  nullDefault The text that should be returned if {@code object}
1491     *      is {@code null}.
1492     *  @return The object's string representation.
1493     *
1494     *  @see    Stringer
1495     */
1496    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1497    public static final <T> String toString( final T value, final Stringer<? super T> stringer, final String nullDefault )
1498    {
1499        requireNonNullArgument( nullDefault, "nullDefault" );
1500
1501        final var retValue = nonNull( value ) ? requireNonNullArgument( stringer, "stringer" ).toString( value ) : nullDefault;
1502
1503        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1504        return retValue;
1505    }   //  toString()
1506}
1507//  class Objects
